node.title: The Babe Rainbow – Today
node.content: It’s always summer with The Babe Rainbow! Their third studio album named “Today” brings positive vibes all over. A groovy bassline, a bit late 60s psychodelia, some bossa nova tunes and a pinch of Afrobeats. One cannot simply resist to chill with their music.
node.excerpt: Today by The Babe Rainbow It’s always summer with The Babe Rainbow! Their third studio album named “Today” brings positive vibes all over. A groovy bassline, a bit late 60s psychodelia, some bossa nova tunes and a pinch of Afrobeats. One cannot simply resist to chill with their music.

node.title: Earth – The Bees Made Honey In The Lion’s Skull
node.content: Lengthy, repetitive and mesmerizing melodies that slowly drown you into the distorted and eerie atmosphere.
node.excerpt: The Bees Made Honey In The Lion's Skull by Earth Lengthy, repetitive and mesmerizing melodies that slowly drown you into the distorted and eerie atmosphere.

node.title: Loscil – Equivalents
node.content: A yesteryear release by the the well-known ambient veteran. In perfect contract to the summer atmosphere and small mindlessness brought by it. Cold and desolate clouds reign over the soul to keep us cool and focused.
node.excerpt: Equivalents by loscil A yesteryear release by the the well-known ambient veteran. In perfect contract to the summer atmosphere and small mindlessness brought by it. Cold and desolate clouds reign over the soul to keep us cool and focused.

node.title: Roy Montgomery – Scenes From The South Island
node.content: Expanded reissue of New Zealand guitar pioneer Roy Montgomery’s rare and revered full-length, Scenes From The South Island, originally released in 1995 by west coast experimental / space rock label Drunken Fish. Recorded on both coasts on a pair of Tascam 4-tracks, the album is alternately wistful, windswept, skeletal, shredded, and strange. Solo guitar figures flow and fray through echo and empty space, evoking loss, long roads, and low-lit landscapes.

node.title: Holy Wave – Interloper
node.content: Originally formed in El Paso, Texas, Holy Wave carefully combines fluid forms of sacred surf sounds, droning riffs, and group vocals that haunt and harmonize in equal measure.
node.excerpt: Originally formed in El Paso, Texas, Holy Wave carefully combines fluid forms of sacred surf sounds, droning riffs, and group vocals that haunt and harmonize in equal measure.

node.title: Julianna Barwick – The Magic Place
node.content: The Magic Place is a place for contemplating life from a tranquil point of view with music that brings comfort and hope. Barwick’s wordless harmonies of layered angelic voices are achieved by multi-tracking her voice through a loop station. Her inspiration for this album is the a-capella church hymns she grew up singing, and such melodies are embraced here to a great extend.
node.excerpt: The Magic Place is a place for contemplating life from a tranquil point of view with music that brings comfort and hope. Her inspiration for this album is the a-capella church hymns she grew up singing, and such…

node.title: Connan Mockasin – Jassbusters
node.content: Nothing is ever straightforward with Connan Mockasin, and nothing should ever be straightforward with Connan Mockasin. This riddled rule has never resounded more than on Jassbusters, Mockasin’s third album and first in five years. An unclassifiable, unconventional album that neither picks up from nor abandons the modes of 2013’s widely-embraced Caramel or its 2010 predecessor Forever Dolphin Love, Jassbusters foreshadows a five-part melodrama titled Bostyn ’n Dobsyn, directed by and staring Mockasin. Jassbusters soundtracks the unpredictable narrative of the television series in eclectic, electric ways.

node.title: Grouper – Dragging A Dead Deer Up a Hill
node.content: Ethereal and dream-like, ambient and dream pop. Impeccable work from Liz Harris.
node.excerpt: Ethereal and dream-like, ambient and dream pop. Impeccable work from Liz Harris.

node.title: Beak> – >>>
node.content: Their third album >>> is, by all measures, their boldest: vocals are emerging from the swamp, drums are getting downright funky (check out the incredible bongo breaks of single “Brean Down”) and the once minimalist trio is now open to string arrangements.
node.excerpt: >>> by Beak> Their third album >>> is, by all measures, their boldest: vocals are emerging from the swamp, drums are getting downright funky (check out the incredible bongo breaks of single “Brean Down”) and the once minimalist trio is now open to string arrangements.

node.title: Swans – leaving meaning.
node.content: Michael Gira – Vocals, words, acoustic/electric guitar, production. I started Swans in NYC in 1982 and have been the primary songwriter, singer and producer throughout the years. In the early years I played bass, but later switched to guitar. During the years of Swans hiatus (1999 – 2010), I released several albums by and toured with a group called Angels of Light.
